last_episode_to_air.name: Happy Trails to You
last_episode_to_air.overview: Bob gives up his psychological practice in Chicago to become a professor at a small college in Oregon.

name: The Bob Newhart Show
overview: The Bob Newhart Show is an American situation comedy produced by MTM Enterprises, which aired 142 original episodes on CBS from September 16, 1972, to April 1, 1978. Comedian Bob Newhart portrays a psychologist having to deal with his patients and fellow office workers. The show was filmed before a live audience.

episodes.name: Fly the Unfriendly Skies
episodes.overview: Bob invites Emily to join his fear of flying group on a trip to New York City. Much to Bob's surprise he finds that Emily also has a fear of flying and refuses to go. After a conversation with Howard she decides to go only to back out after boarding the plane.

episodes.name: Tracy Grammar School, I'll Lick You Yet
episodes.overview: It's Vocation Day in Emily's class, and Bob feels left out when he's not invited. At the last minute, he's asked to fill in, but Emily's worst fears are confirmed when Bob fails to excite the kids' interest.

episodes.name: Tennis, Emily?
episodes.overview: Bob experiences pangs of jealousy when Emily's handsome new tennis instructor comes to see him with an emotional problem, namely, his inability to turn down the women who are all uncontrollably attracted to him.

episodes.name: Mom, I L-L-Love You
episodes.overview: Bob finds it extremely difficult to tell his mother that he loves her.

episodes.name: Goodnight Nancy
episodes.overview: Bob's old girlfriend comes to Chicago with her husband and calls on Emily and Bob.

episodes.name: Come Live with Me
episodes.overview: Carol tries to get Bob to approve her moving in with her new boyfriend Roger, who has just separated from his wife. Bob refuses, telling her she will have to make her own decision.

episodes.name: Father Knows Worst
episodes.overview: Bob's divorced neighbor, Howard Borden, is convinced that his son, Howie, doesn't really like him. Later, Howard's ex-wife convinces him that Howie thinks he is the greatest guy in the world.

episodes.name: Don't Go to Bed Mad
episodes.overview: Bob wants to watch football every Monday night. Emily feels this is unfair: their other activities allow the couple only two nights each week to be together, and she thinks they should do something that they both enjoy. This leads to an unresolved, all-night argument that ends only when the two participants become exhausted.

episodes.name: P-I-L-O-T
episodes.overview:
Bob and Emily have been trying for some time to have a child. When they attend a party where the conversation turns to the subject of children, they feel so left out that they decide to adopt a child.

This is a retooled version of the original pilot.  In order for this episode to fit into the series, the office scenes had to be re-shot.  Originally Jerry Robinson(Peter Bonerz) was a swinging Psychologist and shared office space with Bob.  The characters of receptionist Carol Kester(Marcia Wallace) and patient Elliot Carlin(Jack Riley) were absent.  In fact, the part of Bob's patient was played by the Orthodontist who worked upstairs.  Bob and Emily also lived in a condo and Bob was head of the building association.

episodes.name: Anything Happen While I Was Gone?
episodes.overview: As soon as Bob returns to the office from his vacation in Mexico, Jerry announces that he is about to be married to a girl he met nine days ago. Cynthia, a beautiful but domineering oral hygienist, becomes too much for Jerry, and he realizes that he has made a mistake.

episodes.name: I Want to Be Alone
episodes.overview: Bob decides that for his own mental well-being, he needs some peace and quiet. He moves into a hotel room by himself, leaving a confused Howard Borden thinking that Bob and Emily have split up.

episodes.name: Bob and Emily and Howard and Carol and Jerry
episodes.overview: Howard "floats" into Bob's office on Cloud Nine after having a tooth pulled. He is so poetic that Carol tells Emily, "I want him." Emily agrees to help Carol get him, and the two have an up-and-down romance.

episodes.name: I Owe It All to You... But Not That Much
episodes.overview: Jerry decides there is something wrong with him because he never becomes serious about any of the girls he dates. He asks Bob if he can become one of his patients. Bob agrees, but they have to abandon the plan when it begins to interfere with their friendship.

episodes.name: His Busiest Season
episodes.overview: Christmas becomes a sad memory for Bob's group therapy session, and it's evident that "'tis not the season"" for everyone to be jolly. Bob decides to invite the group over for Christmas Eve.

episodes.name: Let's Get Away From it Almost
episodes.overview: Bob and Emily travel to a ski lodge that's nearly deserted except for the annoying couple with whom they share a bathroom. After sitting through a disastrous dinner, the Hartleys decide to leave only to find themselves caught in the spotlight of the abominable floor show they're trying to escape.

episodes.name: The Crash of 29 Years Old
episodes.overview: Feeling unfulfilled as a woman, and having just passed her 29th birthday, Carol quits her job as Bob's receptionist. After having been gone for a while, Carol suddenly shows up at one of Bob's group-therapy sessions and creates a situation in which Bob finds himself more of a patient than a doctor.

episodes.name: The Man with the Golden Wrist
episodes.overview: Bob refuses to wear the beautiful gold watch Emily gave him for his 40th birthday after he learns just how expensive it was.

episodes.name: The Two Loves of Dr. Hartley
episodes.overview: When one of his patients falls in love with him, Bob has problems at the office and at home.

episodes.name: Not With My Sister You Don't
episodes.overview: Howard Borden's 22-year old sister Debbie arrives to spend the week with him. Emily arranges a blind date for her with Jerry Robinson and Howard suddenly turns into an overprotective big brother.

episodes.name: A Home is Not Necessarily a House
episodes.overview: Bob and Emily try to decide if they should give up their apartment and buy a house.

episodes.name: Emily, I'm Home... Emily?
episodes.overview: Bob is upset when Emily takes a full-time job with the Board of Education. Emily explains that working full-time makes her feel wonderful, while quitting would make her miserable. Bob decides to leave well enough alone.

episodes.name: You Can't Win 'Em All
episodes.overview: When a star pitcher for the Chicago Cubs credits Bob with saving his career, the endorsement brings Bob a new patient, Moose Washburn, a second-string player whose career is beyond a mere psychologist's help.

episodes.name: Bum Voyage
episodes.overview: Afraid that his practice, as well as his patients, will fall apart if he leaves, Bob keeps resisting Emily's plans for a two-month European cruise.

episodes.name: Who's Been Sleeping on My Couch?
episodes.overview: Recovering from another broken romance, Jerry Robinson accepts Bob's invitation to spend a couple of days at his apartment. Bob soon comes to regret his kindness.

episodes.name: Last TV Show
episodes.overview: Bob's therapy group insists that he accept an invitation for the group to conduct one of its weekly sessions on television.

episodes.name: Motel
episodes.overview: A trip to Peoria turns into one long embarrassment for Bob when Jerry introduces him to a pretty girl named Janine. Janine doesn't seem to care that Bob is a married man.

episodes.name: Backlash
episodes.overview: One of Bob's more masculine patients enthusiastically slaps him on the backâ€”and, unfortunately for Bob, it throws his back out. Even more unfortunately, Bob and Emily were supposed to be going to Mexico for a vacation.

episodes.name: Somebody Down Here Likes Me
episodes.overview: Rev. Dan Bradford seeks professional advice from Bobâ€”then makes a startling announcement in his Sunday sermon.

episodes.name: Emily in for Carol
episodes.overview: With Carol on vacation, Emily is elected to fill in as the receptionist. Everyone loves the ideaâ€”except Bob.

episodes.name: Have You Met Miss Dietz?
episodes.overview: Marilyn Dietz, a very attractive divorcee, creates a feud between Jerry and Howard when she starts dating both of them.

episodes.name: Old Man Rivers
episodes.overview: A rather embarrassing operation leads to romance between Carol and her doctor. Everyone questions the relationship due to the new couple's age disparity.

episodes.name: Mister Emily Hartley
episodes.overview: Bob suffers an inferiority attack when a test reveals that Emily's IQ is higher than his.

episodes.name: Mutiny on the Hartley
episodes.overview: Bob decides to meet the rising cost of living by raising his rates. But the members of his therapy group revolt when he picks the most inappropriate moment to tell them.

episodes.name: I'm Okay, You're Okay, So What's Wrong?
episodes.overview: Bob turns out to be an uncooperative patient when Emily makes an appointment for them to see a marriage counselor.

episodes.name: Fit, Fat, and Forty-One
episodes.overview: Determined to lose eight pounds from around his middle, Bob goes on a strict diet. With Jerry's help, he joins a weight-reducing class that seems to be populated mostly by women.

episodes.name: Blues for Mr. Borden
episodes.overview: Howard's son, Howie is visiting. Howard tells Bob he and his ex-wife, Lois, are getting along really well lately, and he thinks she wants to get together again, but Howard's upset to find out she's getting married, and wants Howard's approval.

episodes.name: My Wife Belongs to Daddy
episodes.overview: Emily's parents pay a surprise visit that makes Bob terribly uncomfortable. Emily's father is gregarious, well-traveled, a war hero, an outdoors manâ€”in short, everything that Bob isn't.

episodes.name: T. S. Elliot
episodes.overview: Bob's patient Elliot Carlin parades all his phobias and insecurities as he prepares to ask Carol Kester for a date. He then finds it even harder to accept her answerâ€”which is ""yes.""

episodes.name: I'm Dreaming of a Slight Christmas
episodes.overview: Christmas Eve is almost spoiled when Bob is trapped in the office because of a power failure.

episodes.name: Oh, Brother
episodes.overview: Jerry Robinson's brother shows up in Chicago after finishing dental school. He takes over Jerry's life, his apartment, and his dental practice.

episodes.name: The Modernization of Emily
episodes.overview: Emily decides to update her image with a kicky new wardrobe that she says is youthful and Bob says is childish.

episodes.name: The Jobless Corps
episodes.overview: Depressed after losing his job with the airline, Howard accepts Bob's offer to join his ""out of workshop,"" a special therapy group for the unemployed. (Bob extends the invitation at Emily's insistence when Howard's attempts to help her around the apartment begin driving her up the wall.)

episodes.name: Clink Shrink
episodes.overview: Hoping to make a contribution to society, Bob offers his psychological counseling services free to a parolee out on an armed-robbery conviction. But Bob seems to be more influenced by his patient's manner than the patient is by Bob's therapy.

episodes.name: Mind Your Own Business
episodes.overview: At Jerry's urging, Bob hires a business manager to handle his money. He ends up living on a meager allowance that affords him only such luxuries as peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for lunch.

episodes.name: A Love Story
episodes.overview: Howard falls head over heels in love with Bob's sister Ellen. Under most circumstances, Bob would find this perfectly acceptableâ€”except that Ellen is getting married to someone else.

episodes.name: By the Way... You're Fired
episodes.overview: When Carol's new love interest interferes with her work, Jerry Robinson doesn't seemed too concerned. But when it disrupts his love life, he decides to fire her.

episodes.name: Confessions of An Orthodontist
episodes.overview: While filling in for a fellow psychologist, Bob is surprised to find that his first patient is Jerry Robinson, who is reluctant to reveal his problem. A little prodding produces the startling admission that Jerry is in love with Emily.

episodes.name: A Matter of Principal
episodes.overview: It's a matter of principal versus principle when Emily refuses to skip one of her students ahead two grades at the elementary school where she teaches.

episodes.name: Big Brother is Watching
episodes.overview: Bob is faced with the possibility that his younger sister, Ellen, may move in with Howard, her boyfriend.

episodes.name: The Battle of the Groups
episodes.overview: Bob takes two of his therapy groups to a rustic retreat for a marathon session that never progresses further than everyone's complaints about the primitive conditions of their accommodations.

episodes.name: The Great Rimpau Medical Arts Co-Op Experiment
episodes.overview: Dr Newman removed a wart from Bob's neck and charged him. Bob tells Jerry he should have done it for free since Bob had helped him with his marriage. Jerry agrees and sets up a plan where all the doctors treat each other for free.

episodes.name: The Separation Story
episodes.overview: For the sake of their marriageâ€”as well as Emily's Master's Degree and Bob's heavy work scheduleâ€”the Hartleys decide that it would be best if they took up separate residences.

episodes.name: Sorry, Wrong Mother
episodes.overview: As Howard prepares to introduce Howie to Ellen, he tries to remold Ellen into an image the boy will like.

episodes.name: The Gray Flannel Shrink
episodes.overview: Bob gives up most of his private practice to become the staff psychologist with a major insurance company. He soon learns that it's possible for a man in the corporate world to do his job too well.

episodes.name: Dr. Ryan's Express
episodes.overview: Bob's office routine becomes a wreck when Jerry hires a temporary receptionist. She's a very nice but very vague woman who can't even get Bob's name straight.

episodes.name: Brutally Yours, Bob Hartley
episodes.overview: Having preached honesty in relationships to his patients, Bob decides to follow his own advice. Immediately he offends two dinner guests and starts an argument with Emily.

episodes.name: Ship of Shrinks
episodes.overview: Bob's first literary venture turns out to be less than triumphant. His embarrassment makes him reluctant to join a convention of psychologists on a flight to Hawaii, especially when he finds out that Howard is the navigator.

episodes.name: Life is a Hamburger
episodes.overview: Carol's announcement that she's going to marry Don Feslerâ€”an unpublished poet with bad feetâ€”brings negative reactions from her friends.

episodes.name: An American Family
episodes.overview: Emily's plans for a wonderful turkey dinner go downhill when Bob's mother and Emily's father begin insulting one another the night before Thanksgiving.

episodes.name: We Love You... Good-Bye
episodes.overview: Bob forms an all-women consciousness-raising group. He gets kicked out after Emily joins and inadvertently points out some of the unliberated areas in their own marriage.

episodes.name: Jerry Robinson Crusoe
episodes.overview: After renewing an acquaintance with the beautiful and free-spirited Courtney Simpson, Jerry decides to give up his dental practice: he wants to follow his dreams of romance and adventure by taking Miss Simpson to Tahiti.

episodes.name: Serve for Daylight
episodes.overview: Bob thinks his chances of winning a doctor's tennis tournament are pretty good until he learns that his doubles partner will be Emily.

episodes.name: Home is Where the Hurt Is
episodes.overview: Facing the depressing prospect of returning home to Iowa to spend the holidays with her domineering parents, Carol brings her troubles to Bob's apartment. There she spends Christmas Eve pouring out the disasters of her childhood.

episodes.name: Tobin's Back in Town
episodes.overview: Ellen's ex-fiancee, John Tobinâ€”a tall, handsome egomaniac in suede and leatherâ€”arrives in Chicago to win Ellen back. The situation plays havoc with Howard's basic insecurities.

episodes.name: Think Smartly--Vote Hartley
episodes.overview: Before he has a chance to say no, Bob finds himself running for the chairman of the local school board against an incumbent who hasn't attended a board meeting for six months.

episodes.name: The Way We Weren't
episodes.overview: Emily is more than a little curious about Bob's reluctance to talk about a girl he used to date. Then Howard inadvertently spills the beans.

episodes.name: A Pound of Flesh
episodes.overview: Bob and Jerry have a falling-out when Jerry demands that Bob lend him money for a new motorcycle.

episodes.name: My Business is Shrinking
episodes.overview: With his confidence fading as fast as his list of patients, Bob decides to follow Emily's advice and see a psychiatrist about his problem.

episodes.name: The New Look
episodes.overview: Emily redecorates the apartment in antiques. Bob finds her choice of furniture uncomfortable, unappealing, and hazardous to his health.

episodes.name: Bob Hits the Ceiling
episodes.overview: Bob breaks a long-standing rule against treating friends when he agrees to counsel Emily's chum, whose marriage to a muscular gym teacher seems to be breaking up.

episodes.name: Emily Hits the Ceiling
episodes.overview: Emily agrees to help operate a children's summer camp and tries to persuade Bob to be one of the counselors.

episodes.name: The Ceiling Hits Bob
episodes.overview: Bob becomes the ""oldest permanent psychologist in Chicago"" when the ceiling in his office collapses and he has to set up shop wherever he can find the space.

episodes.name: The Longest Good-Bye
episodes.overview: Bob's old school friend Murdock is in town for a day to sell a complex giveaway item to a Chicago cereal company. Bob invites him to stay overnight at his home. The brief encounter stretches out to a week when Murdock can't make his business connections. He gradually takes over Bob's car, clothing, and most of his home life.

episodes.name: Here's Looking at You, Kid
episodes.overview: Howard insists on joining Bob and Emily's anniversary dinner at a fashionable Chicago restaurant in order to enlist their aid in popping the question to Ellen. But he chokes up in the clutch, and Bob is forced to do the proposing for him.

episodes.name: Death of a Fruitman
episodes.overview: Bob's patients observe tradition by planning a surprise party to honor the fourth year of the group's therapy sessions. When an unseen member, a Mr. Gianelli, threatens to turn the party into a disaster, Bob kicks him out of the group. His decision meets with instant group approval until Mr. Gianelli dies under a ton of zucchini.

episodes.name: Change is Gonna Do Me Good
episodes.overview: Emily accuses Bob of being stuck in a middle-aged rut and challenges him to switch family responsibilities.

episodes.name: The Heavyweights
episodes.overview: Bob and Emily invite Carol to share her ""heavy"" experiences with the ""overweight workshop.""

episodes.name: Carol's Wedding
episodes.overview: A blind-date-initiated, 12-hour romance culminates in Carol Kester's civil marriage to a handsome travel agent.

episodes.name: Shrinks Across the Sea
episodes.overview: Bob and Emily suffer international complications when they host a French psychologist in their home as part of a medical exchange program.

episodes.name: What's It All About, Albert?
episodes.overview: Bob is depressed by his seeming lack of success as a psychologist. He seeks help from his old college professor, who manages to heighten his despair by informing him that psychology is all nonsense.

episodes.name: Who is Mr. X?
episodes.overview: Bob accepts a seemingly innocent invitation to appear as the guest on a TV discussion program. He winds up in the jaws of a dilemma when the show host turns out to have the disposition of a shark.

episodes.name: Seemed Like a Good Idea at the Time
episodes.overview: Bob moves up in the world from the seventh to the tenth floor when he joins the firm of a swinging psychiatrist.

episodes.name: Over the River and Through the Woods
episodes.overview: It's a stag Thanksgiving for Bob when Emily flies off to join a family reunion, leaving Bob to share the holiday with his male buddies.

episodes.name: Fathers and Sons and Mothers
episodes.overview: Bob suffers family problems when his mother becomes a houseguest and an elderly patient involves him in a parent-child vendetta.

episodes.name: The Article
episodes.overview: When she's given an assignment to see what makes a bunch of doctors tick, inquiring news reporter Ellen Hartley gives Bob and his medical cohorts the tell-it-like-it-is treatment.

episodes.name: A Matter of Vice-Principal
episodes.overview: Emily must contend with irate teachers, hamsters, and an escaped snake when she's unexpectedly upped to the position of school vice principal.

episodes.name: Bob Has to Have His Tonsils Out, So He Spends Christmas Eve in the Hospital
episodes.overview: Christmas Eve finds Bob in the hospital with tonsillitis and an impending operation. Meanwhile, his friends are all suffering from an attack of Christmas-itis.

episodes.name: No Sale
episodes.overview: Bob becomes his patient's partner in a get-rich-quick real-estate venture.

episodes.name: Carol at 6:01
episodes.overview: Bob contends with a patient's delusion that her bingo game is fixed, staggers through a series of wild poker parties, and watches in wonder as his secretary slowly smothers under an attack of love.

episodes.name: Warden Gordon Borden
episodes.overview: Howard's game-warden brother comes to Chicago to witness the mating of two whooping cranesâ€”and stays to make a play for Howard's girlfriend.

episodes.name: My Boy Guillermo
episodes.overview: Jerry Robinson's depression turns to instant joy when a globe-trotting ex-flame suddenly re-enters his life and proposes.

episodes.name: Duke of Dunk
episodes.overview: A professional basketball team hires Bob to give a psychological assist to its superstar.

episodes.name: Guaranteed Not to Shrink
episodes.overview: Bob develops a unique psychological problem when his receptionist, Carol, decides to resume her college career and become a psychologist.

episodes.name: Birth of a Salesman
episodes.overview: The Hartleys are bombarded with legal hassles when Bob is sued by a shy patient and Emily decides to fight a parking ticket.

episodes.name: The Boy Next Door
episodes.overview: The Hartleys entertain Howard Borden's young son and hire a beauty queen as his babysitter.

episodes.name: Peeper Two
episodes.overview: Cliff Murdock, Bob's old laugh-a-minute college buddy, affectionately known as The Peeper, pays a return visit.

episodes.name: Enter Mrs. Peeper
episodes.overview: Bob receives a telegram saying that his old college chum, ""The Peeper,"" is coming to Chicago and bringing a surprise. The surprise turns out to be a brand-new bride.

episodes.name: Caged Fury
episodes.overview: The Hartleys miss their friend's gala Fourth of July Bicentennial party celebration when they become trapped in a storage locker.

episodes.name: Some of My Best Friends Are...
episodes.overview: Bob's therapy group has an unexpected visitor when a friendly homosexual joins in the sessions.

episodes.name: Still Crazy After All These Years
episodes.overview: The Hartleys take a vacation. In their absence, Howard undergoes a crash psychological program that changes his entire personality.

episodes.name: The Great Rent Strike
episodes.overview: The Hartley apartment becomes a hot and cold battleground when the good doctor declares psychological warfare on his landlord.

episodes.name: Et, Tu, Carol?
episodes.overview: Both Bob's receptionist and a Buddha figure with a clock in its navel give the psychologist a hard time.

episodes.name: Send This Boy to Camp
episodes.overview: Bob and his friends host an orphan contingent for a wildly improbable camping-out experience.

episodes.name: A Crime Most Foul
episodes.overview: Bob turns amateur detective when he believes that his expensive tape recorder has been stolen.

episodes.name: The Slammer
episodes.overview: Bob and his friend ""The Peeper"" take a trip down Memory Lane and wind up in the slammer.

episodes.name: Jerry's Retirement
episodes.overview: Bob defends the work ethic when Jerry comes into a pile of money and promptly retires from the dental profession.

episodes.name: Here's to You, Mrs. Robinson
episodes.overview: Jerry, retired orthodontist and orphan, takes off on a world tour to search for his long-lost parents.

episodes.name: Breaking Up is Hard to Do
episodes.overview: Bob undergoes a shock when his mother announces that she has separated from his father after 47 years of marriage.

episodes.name: Making Up is the Thing to Do
episodes.overview: Bob takes on the role of Christmas peacemaker when he attempts to reconcile his parents.

episodes.name: Love is the Blindest
episodes.overview: Bob watches in amazement as one of his patients supports a blossoming romance with a tissue of lies.

episodes.name: The Ironwood Experience
episodes.overview: Bob's invitation to lecture at a prestigious sex seminar results in distress when the audience shows up nude.

episodes.name: Of Mice and Men
episodes.overview: Bob runs into marital problems when he brings his therapy group home for a wild role-playing encounter.

episodes.name: Halls of Hartley
episodes.overview: Bob succumbs to the pressures of living in a big city and desperately seeks employment of a small rural college.

episodes.name: The Heartbreak Kidd
episodes.overview: Bob thinks that Veronica Kidd, a student trainee, has fallen in love with him.

episodes.name: Death Be My Destiny
episodes.overview: Bob strikes out against a friend's fear of falling, but succumbs to the same phobia himself when he is subjected to a harrowing elevator experience.

episodes.name: Taxation Without Celebration
episodes.overview: Bob's memory is taxed to the limit when he forgets that April 15 is the Federal income tax deadlineâ€”and also the date of the Hartleys' seventh wedding anniversary.

episodes.name: Desperate Sessions
episodes.overview: Bob is held hostage in his office by a friendly bank robber.

episodes.name: The Mentor
episodes.overview: A despondent friend accepts Bob's suggestion and turns the psychologist's reception area into a mini-Polynesian village.

episodes.name: Shrinking Violence
episodes.overview: Bob offers sound psychological advice to his wife and his therapy group on how to handle anger. Then he proceeds to blow up himself.

episodes.name: You're Having My Hartley
episodes.overview: Hot baby news is the order of the day when Carol, Bob's receptionist, announces that she's expecting a baby. Then, Emily drops her bombshellâ€”and Bob nearly comes unglued at the prospect of becoming a father.

episodes.name: Bob's Change of Life
episodes.overview: Bob's well-ordered life turns topsy-turvy when he and Emily move to a new Chicago residence.

episodes.name: Ex-Con Job
episodes.overview: Bob's attempt at treating convicts who are about to be released has him climbing the walls.

episodes.name: A Jackie Story
episodes.overview: Jerry is terrified of losing his new dream girl.

episodes.name: Who Was That Masked Man?
episodes.overview: Bob is puzzled when his henpecked patient, Mr. Petersen, asserts himself with far-reaching consequences.

episodes.name: Carlin's New Suit
episodes.overview: Bob deals with the amusing problems of an improbable paternity suit and a phone paging service that never pages him.

episodes.name: A Day in the Life
episodes.overview: Bob's impulsive decision to leave town for a week is received with disastrous emotions by his patients, who seemingly can't make it without him.

episodes.name: My Son the Comedian
episodes.overview: It's no laughing matter for Howard when his 12 year old son Howie announces he's leaving home to become a comedian.

episodes.name: You're Fired, Mr. Chips
episodes.overview: Bob interviews a variety of psychologists to take over his patients while he's out of town. It's soon apparent that they are very much in need of help themselves. When Bob's former teacher, Professor Dreebe, offers his services, it seems the perfect answer.

episodes.name: Shallow Throat
episodes.overview: At first, Bob is thrilled when a nontalkative patient named Mr. Twillmer finally opens up after being told that anything he might say will be held in the strictest confidence. His joy is short-lived when Twillmer confesses to grand larceny.

episodes.name: A Girl in Her Twenties
episodes.overview: Emily's protective instincts are aroused when 70-year-old Grace DuBois, an odd but friendly recluse, is threatened with being sent to a rest home for elderly people who can't cope with reality.

episodes.name: Grand Delusion
episodes.overview: Bob and Emily celebrate their 10th wedding anniversary with a dream flight into the fantasy of being married to different partners.

episodes.name: 'Twas the Pie Before Christmas
episodes.overview: Bob finds himself with unhappy and hostile patients who refuse to attend his Christmas party when they are mistakenly informed of a rate increase at the height of the Yuletide season. One patient is moved to hire a pie-throwing service.

episodes.name: Freudian Ship
episodes.overview: The Hartleys embark on a seagoing vacation to put work behind them. But Bob can't resist playing psychologist when he undertakes to counsel a married couple.

episodes.name: Grizzly Emily
episodes.overview: Emily Hartley discovers a new low in male chauvinism when Bob's father arranges a fishing trip to his cabin and assigns her woman's work while the men brave the great out-of-doors.

episodes.name: Son of an Ex-Con Job
episodes.overview: Bob counsels a quintet of jovial ex-convicts to help them find honest employment.

episodes.name: Group on a Hot Tin Roof
episodes.overview: Bob advises a patient named Mr. Plager to realize his human potential by writing a play based on his own experiences. But when Plager writes, directs, and produces an actual World War I drama whose characters bear a startling resemblance to the rest of Bob's patients, the warfare really begins.

episodes.name: Emily Carlin, Emily Carlin
episodes.overview: Bob's paranoid, perennial patient, Mr. Carlin, involves Emily in his scheme to impress his former schoolmatesâ€”especially a girl who never gave him the time of day.

episodes.name: Easy for You to Say
episodes.overview: Paul Billinghamâ€”known to his radio fans as Ralph Alfalfa, the Happy Farmerâ€”comes to Bob because of his stuttering problem. On radio, he practiced several unseen rhythmic devices to mask his problem, but a new television opportunity threatens to expose his problem with disastrous results.

episodes.name: It Didn't Happen One Night
episodes.overview: Bob's friends close ranks to ""protect"" Emily Hartley when a handsome old flame pays her a very warm visit.

episodes.name: Carol Ankles for Indie-Prod
episodes.overview: On the eve of being announced ""Secretary of the Year,"" Carol informs Bob that she's leaving his employ.

episodes.name: Crisis in Education
episodes.overview: At the school where Emily works, low reading scores prompt indignant outbursts and threats from angry parents. Principal Phil Bannister flees their wrath by going on an extended fishing tripâ€”but not before he tells Emily to handle the crisis.

episodes.name: Happy Trails to You
episodes.overview: Bob gives up his psychological practice in Chicago to become a professor at a small college in Oregon.
